Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350Â°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.** You can use butter or cooking spray for greasing the pan.

Combine the Corn Kernels, Milk, Eggs, Melted Butter, and Vanilla Extract in a blender. Blend until mostly smooth, with some small corn kernel pieces remaining for texture. Alternatively, you can use a food processor to achieve a similar consistency.
In a large bowl, whisk together the Sugar, All-Purpose Flour, Baking Powder, and Salt.
Pour the wet ingredients (blended corn mixture) from the blender into the dry ingredients (flour mixture) in the bowl.** Stir with a spatula until just combined. Do not overmix.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan.** Smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake the Pan de Elote for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cornbread cool slightly in the pan for about 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
Optional Step: Once cool, dust the top of the Pan de Elote with powdered sugar for a touch of sweetness and visual appeal.
Serve Mexican Cornbread (Pan de Elote) warm or at room temperature.** Enjoy it on its own as a snack or dessert, or pair it with savory dishes like chili or stews.
Storage: Leftover Pan de Elote can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days, or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
